page.title: 02THOMAS HARDY
page.content:
{Thomas Hardy}was born in a cottage at{ {Higher Bockhampton,}on the 2nd July,1840. One of about 10 houses in the village, it is now owned by the National Trust. The cottage is open to visitors, by appointment, daily from 11am to 6pm, from April till October. There are 1500 visitors a year. 70% of these are British and 30% American, Japanese and Contental.To see this house, it costs Â£1. But his gardens are free.While he lived there,{Thomas {Hardy}wrote many of his books including{The Greenwood Tree}and{Far {from the Madding Crowd.}
Around{Hardy's Cottage}is{Thorncombe {woods,}a large mainly decidous wood, and to the east of that is{Blackheath} which until recently was just heathland but now has become partly over grown with birches.
